com.kinvey
Class KinveyResource

java.lang.Object
  com.kinvey.KinveyResource

public class KinveyResource
extends Object

Representation of a Bitmap, File, Sound or Video resource stored using Kinvey's file api.

Provides the ability to download assets that have been previously saved. Downloads may be performed in different ways depending on the type of asset. In the case of video getUriForResource() is very useful as most mediaplayer apis will take a url for streaming video.

Constructor Detail

KinveyResource

public KinveyResource(KCSClient client,
                      String assetname)
Representation of an asset stored using kinvey's file api service.

Parameters:
client - obtains the user name, host, and port settings from this instance
assetname - used to save the asset in kinvey file service, can be used to retrieve the asset as well

KinveyResource

protected KinveyResource(KCSClient client,
                         String assetname,
                         com.kinvey.net.RequestBuilderFactory rbfactory)
Used directly only in testing.

Parameters:
client - obtains the user name, host, and port settings from this instance
assetname - used to save the asset in kinvey file service, can be used to retrieve the asset as well
rbfactory - used to override the default RequestBuilder with a mock
Method Detail

getUriForResource

public String getUriForResource()
                         throws KinveyException
Performs a network request to kinvey service to get the source location of the file

Returns:
Uri for streaming
Throws:
KinveyException - if anything goes wrong with the request or the response is not Response.SC_OK

getUriForResource

public void getUriForResource(KinveyCallback<String> cb)
Uses a background thread to get the uri of the resource for which a client would want to stream data.

Really useful when using MediaPlayer

Parameters:
cb - the callback to get triggered when the request completes

openRawResource

public InputStream openRawResource()
                            throws KinveyException
Gets the InputStream from the underlying HttpEntity instance. The caller of this method must clean up the resource by invoking InputStream.close() method when its done with reading data.

Returns:
stream to get data from the response. Important: to avoid memory problems, remember to call InputStream.close() when you're done.
Throws:
KinveyException - if response is not Response.SC_OK

openRawResource

public void openRawResource(KinveyCallback<InputStream> cb)
Uses a background thread to open the assets inputstream.

Parameters:
cb - callback for this request

remove

public void remove()
            throws KinveyException
Removes file using kinvey blob api. First a request to remove the file is made to kinvey. Then the delete request is sent to the host storage system, usually Azure.

Throws:
KinveyException - if anything happens during any part of the request

remove

public void remove(KinveyCallback<Void> cb)
Uses a background thread to remove the asset

Parameters:
cb - callback for this request

upload

public void upload(byte[] data)
            throws KinveyException
Uploads the byte array using an InputStream, avoids copying the byte[].

Parameters:
data - uploads this data to kinvey service
Throws:
KinveyException - thrown if an error occurs at any moment during communication

upload

public void upload(byte[] data,
                   KinveyCallback<Void> cb)
Uses a background thread to upload the data.

Parameters:
data - the data to upload to kinvey's file service
cb - the callback to be triggered when the request is done

upload

public void upload(File file)
            throws KinveyException
Save the file object using the Kinvey BLOB API.

Throws:
KinveyException - if the file transmission fails for any reason or Response.SC_CREATED is not returned

upload

public void upload(File file,
                   KinveyCallback<Void> cb)
Uses a background thread to upload the file.

Parameters:
file - the file to upload to kinvey's file service
cb - the callback to be triggered when the request is done
